content:
Based on your preferences, here are some fuel-efficient sedans and hatchbacks that fit your budget and driving habits:

**Hybrid Options:**

1. **Toyota Corolla Hybrid**: 53 mpg highway, 52 mpg city. A hybrid version of the popular Corolla sedan, with a smooth ride and excellent fuel economy. ($23,650 - $27,750)
2. **Honda Insight Hybrid**: 51 mpg highway, 56 mpg city. A compact sedan with a spacious interior and impressive fuel efficiency. ($23,870 - $28,590)
3. **Hyundai Ioniq Hybrid**: 52 mpg highway, 53 mpg city. A compact car available in hybrid, plug-in hybrid, and electric variants, with a comfortable ride and feature-packed interior. ($23,550 - $28,550)

**Non-Hybrid Options:**

1. **Honda Civic Sedan**: 42 mpg highway, 32 mpg city. A reliable and fun-to-drive compact sedan with a reputation for excellent fuel economy. ($20,650 - $24,450)
2. **Chevrolet Cruze**: 40 mpg highway, 30 mpg city. A comfortable and feature-packed compact sedan with a strong turbocharged engine. ($19,995 - $24,395)
3. **Nissan Sentra**: 39 mpg highway, 29 mpg city. A solid compact sedan with a spacious interior and good fuel economy. ($19,360 - $23,610)
4. **Kia Forte**: 40 mpg highway, 31 mpg city. A well-equipped compact sedan with a comfortable ride and strong fuel economy. ($18,490 - $23,490)

**Other Options to Consider:**

1. **Mazda3 Sedan**: 40 mpg highway, 28 mpg city. A fun-to-drive compact sedan with a premium feel and good fuel economy. ($21,640 - $26,640)
2. **Subaru Impreza Sedan**: 36 mpg highway, 27 mpg city. A safe and reliable compact sedan with all-wheel drive as standard. ($23,595 - $28,595)

These are just a few options to get you started. I recommend researching each model, reading reviews, and test-driving a few to find the best fit for you.

Do any of these options stand out to you, or would you like me to suggest a few more?
